body.name: REOLINK 4K Outdoor Cameras for Home Security, Surveillance IP PoE Camera with Human/Vehicle/Pet Detection, 25FPS Daytime, Work with Smart Home, Supports 256GB microSD Card, RLC-810A (Pack of 2)
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 9 hrs 37 mins
features: 4K UlTRA HD VISUAL FEAST: This PoE security camera jumps from 5MP to 4K (8MP) Ultra HD, which is 1.6X clearer than 5MP and 4X clearer than 1080p. With the ability to capture 4K at 25fps videos, astoundingly sharp and crisp details around home or store will be reproduced perfectly in live streaming and playback.

HUMAN VEHICLE DETECTION WITH SMART ALERTS: This PoE IP camera can identify people and vehicles in terms of their shapes, which minimizes unnecessary alarms such as animals or shadows. It can also specify the type of detection when sending motion alerts to you. You can know what happened by just glancing at the phone screen.

REMOTE ACCESS & SMART PLAYBACK: With simple and intuitive Reolink App without extra fee, check what’s happening in your home or office anytime and anywhere. Quickly filter videos by person/vehicle events, and locate the moments you need by the timeline, all within a few clicks.

FASTER AND SIMPLIFIED POE INSTALLATION: Thanks to the power over Ethernet (PoE) technology, this outdoor bullet camera can transmit videos and get power, signal, data via only one network cable. You can install this camera quickly and easily for a reliable connection.

2-YEAR WARRANTY & LIFETIME TECH SUPPORT: Users are provided with a 30-day money-back guarantee and 2 years limited warranty. Any issues with the product, simply contact us to enjoy lifetime tech support and product maintenance. Reolink is on standby around the clock.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 475 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: RLC-810A 8MP Smarten Up Your Home Security RLC-810A security cameras come with keen and sharp 4K 'eyes' that recognize human/vehicle/pet events.

Outstanding 4K@25fps UHD Videos These outdoor PoE security cameras shoot 4K high-quality videos at 25fps, delivering an unparalleled smoother and clearer viewing experience than ever. Details you see around home or store will be recorded perfectly in live streaming and playback, no matter day or night. Flexible Recording & Storage Options These security cameras can optionally record motions events or 24/7 to a microSD card (Up to 256GB, not included), Reolink NVR, or FTP server. More space provided by the microSD card, longer footage can be saved under default bitrate in 24/7 recording schedule.

Remote Access Anywhere Live view anytime via the Reolink app/client. Each camera supports up to 2 main-stream and 10 sub-stream to view simultaneously on different devices. Work With Smart Home Get the cameras to join your smart home! Just tell your device to show you the camera, and you will see live feed on your Chromecast-enabled TVs. See the Day in a Minute Time-lapse function allows you to see the whole construction process or capture beautiful views from sunrise to sundown, in just a few minutes. IP66 Waterproof With the rugged housing and body, these security cameras can keep guard anywhere, outdoor or indoor, and in any harsh weather conditions.

How to get the cameras working? With the power from IEEE802.3af PoE switch/injector (NOT included) via one CAT5,6, or 7 ethernet cable (up to 330ft, two 3.3ft cables included), you could set up and access each camera via Reolink App, Reolink PC client, or web browser. Will these work with the Reolink NVR or system? Yes, it does. Reolink NVRs with the hardware version of N2MB02/H3MB18/N3MB01/N7MB01 support the smart detection/playback for the RLC-810A. You can verify the compatibility via the System Information of the NVR. Are the cameras compatible with third-party software/System/NVR? The RLC-810A IP cameras are compatible with some third-party software such as Blue Iris on Synology using RTSP or RTMP protocol. However, third-party NVR is NOT supported.

4K Outdoor Security Camera RLC-810A Specifications Image Sensor 1/2.49" CMOS Sensor Video Resolution 3840x2160 (8.0 Megapixels) at 25 frames/sec Lens f=4.0mm fixed; F=2.0, with IR-cut filter Night Vision 30 meters (100ft) PoE Power IEEE 802.3af PoE Switch/Injector, 48V Active (Not included) Field of View Horizontal: 87° Vertical: 44° Video Compression Format H.265 Smart Alarm Motion detection/Human detection/Vehicle detection OS Supported PC: Windows, Mac OS; Smartphone: iOS, Android; Web Browser (Edge, Chrome, Firefox, Safari) Record Mode Motion-triggered recording (default); scheduled recording; 24/7 recording

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent. Great, great buy
reviews.reviewText: Ok so this one was a bit of a mixed bag at first. Out of the box I had some annoyances. The advertised car and human detection was kind of there but in a very poor way. The alarms were annoying and simplistic. I could not get the high quality stream to work right. I was unable to pair it with my NVR. Just overall annoyed and thought it was all a marketing scam.Then I discovered that there is a firmware update. Oh my. Am I happy with these cameras now. The picture quality is excellent for the price point. The function set is second to none (at this price point). The app thing really works, its not just a badly made afterthought with bad English. The whole concept is good enough that you really could just buy this with no NVR, put in a decent size flash disk and you have your monitoring sorted. Its just awesome. I have a lot of cams. None of them come anywhere close to this brand. This is pure value for money. I am replacing all of my cams with this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: We have had these cameras outside out home for over 1 year. They work great in all types of weather. Good Night vision. Easy to set up if cables are already in place. Never miss a recording.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent POE Camera
reviews.reviewText: Good camera for the price. Integrates quickly with the REOLINK App or Scrypted as an RTSP camera for use with HomeKit. The motion alerts are a bit teadeous to get tweaked just right.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These Work Well
reviews.reviewText: We have four of these cameras up outside, and have the displays on our computer monitors and our phones. I have a little trouble with the menu on my phone, for example the menu that is supposed to speed up playback does not respond. These are wired, so we had to cut a hole in the wall. I like being able to see the big display on my large monitor but also the convenience of seeing it on my phone downstairs. Picture quality is pretty good. I don't like the watermark logo they feel the need to put on, it makes it hard to see the upper left of the footage. No reason for that to be there.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The best product I bought in my whole Amazon time

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great value. Reolink is the best system.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality, simplistic cameras to hook up
reviews.reviewText: These cameras are very easy to mount, and hook up. Picture quality is great. Highly reccomend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Constantly disconnects for no reason. Extremely poorly made native software and apps with intrusive privacy features that are the opposite of "security." Becomes non-functional at low temperatures. One of the sd card slots were misaligned and I had to fix it with a screwdriver. You can definitely find better cameras than these. They're a good deal but sometimes you get what you pay for, such as in this case, where you pay for garbage.
